item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Redis is open source again (336 points | 123 comments)
2. We identified a North Korean hacker who tried to get a job at Kraken (200 points | 153 comments)
3. Claude can now connect to your world (43 points | 7 comments)
4. A faster way to copy SQLite databases between computers (276 points | 125 comments)
5. Linkwarden: FOSS self-hostable bookmarking with AI-tagging and page archival (113 points | 44 comments)
6. Waypoint Transit (YC W25) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer ( | hide)
7. Show HN: Mechanical Computer Kit (Roons) (32 points | 8 comments)
8. Judge Rules Apple Executive Lied Under Oath, Makes Criminal Contempt Referral (465 points | 167 comments)
9. Starting July 1, Academic Publishers Can't Paywall NIH-Funded Research (133 points | 19 comments)
10. Trust Me, I'm Local: Chrome Extensions, MCP, and the Sandbox Escape (85 points | 22 comments)
11. Office is too slow, so Microsoft is making it load at Windows startup (564 points | 721 comments)
12. How to vibe code for free: Running Qwen3 on your Mac, using MLX (167 points | 113 comments)
13. Fivetran to acquire Census (8 points | discuss)
14. The term "vegetative electron microscopy" keeps showing up in scientific papers (70 points | 18 comments)
15. 108B Pixel Scan of Johannes Vermeer's Girl with a Pearl Earring (408 points | 118 comments)
16. International Workers' Day (229 points | 88 comments)
17. A senior Apple exec could be jailed in Epic case; it's time to end this disaster (31 points | discuss)
18. Show HN: Hyperparam: OSS Tools for Exploring Datasets Locally in the Browser (29 points | 16 comments)
19. Mercury: Commercial-scale diffusion language model (366 points | 159 comments)
20. The one interview question that will protect you from North Korean fake workers (164 points | 131 comments)
21. Vanguard 50-year anniversary CEO letter (135 points | 144 comments)
22. Apple violated antitrust ruling, judge finds (1010 points | 468 comments)
23. Pwning the Ladybird Browser (292 points | 47 comments)
24. Why some Mac apps launch slowly: A follow-up (41 points | 2 comments)
25. The Brief Origins of May Day (162 points | 165 comments)
26. Espressif's ESP32-C5 Is Now in Mass Production (228 points | 159 comments)
27. All roses were once yellow (34 points | 1 comment)
28. How the US defense secretary circumvents official DoD communications equipment (365 points | 333 comments)
29. When ChatGPT Broke an Entire Field: An Oral History (29 points | 5 comments)
30. All four major web browsers are about to lose 80% of their funding (540 points | 546 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, May 1, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
